autoop.core.ml.artifact module

class autoop.core.ml.artifact.Artifact(name: str, data: bytes, asset_path: str = None, type: str = '', version: str = '1.0.0', tags: list[str] = [], metadata: dict = {})[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a data artifact with metadata and version control.

name

The name of the artifact.

Type:

str

data

The binary data of the artifact.

Type:

bytes

asset_path

The file path or identifier for the artifact.

Type:

str

type

The type or category of the artifact.

Type:

str

version

Version identifier of the artifact. Default is ‘1.0.0’.

Type:

str

tags

List of tags associated with the artifact.

Type:

list[str]

metadata

Additional metadata for the artifact.

Type:

dict

property id: str

Dynamically generate a unique identifier for the artifact based.

Returns:

A base64 encoded identifier of the format

’encoded_path:version’.

Return type:

str

read() → bytes[source]

Read the artifact data.

Returns:

The binary data of the artifact.

Return type:

bytes

save(data: bytes) → bytes[source]

Save new data to the artifact.

Parameters:

data (bytes) – The new data to store in the artifact.

Returns:

The updated binary data of the artifact.

bytes

static from_dataframe(data: DataFrame, name: str, asset_path: str, version: str = '1.0.0') → Dataset[source]

Create a Dataset artifact from a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to be saved as a Dataset artifact.

  • name (str) – The name of the dataset artifact.

  • asset_path (str) – The path or identifier for the dataset artifact.

  • version (str, optional) – Version identifier for the dataset. Default is “1.0.0”.

Returns:

An instance of Dataset artifact based on the dataframe.

Return type:

Dataset

read() → DataFrame[source]

Return the dataframe from the Dataset artifact.

Returns:

The Dataset’s data as a pandas DataFrame.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

save(data: DataFrame) → bytes[source]

Save a new pandas DataFrame to the dataset artifact.

Encodes the DataFrame to binary CSV format and updates the artifact’s data.

Parameters:

data (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to be saved to the artifact.

Returns:

The updated binary data of the dataset.

Return type:

bytes

autoop.core.ml.pipeline module

class autoop.core.ml.pipeline.Pipeline(metrics: List[Metric], dataset: Dataset, model: Model, input_features: List[Feature], target_feature: Feature, split: float = 0.8)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a machine learning pipeline.

Combines data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation.

metrics

List of evaluation metrics.

Type:

List[Metric]

dataset

The dataset to be used in the pipeline.

Type:

Dataset

model

The model to be trained and evaluated.

Type:

Model

input_features

Features used as model inputs.

Type:

List[Feature]

target_feature

The target feature to be predicted.

Type:

Feature

split

Fraction of data used for training. Default is 0.8.

Type:

float

property artifacts: List[Artifact]

Retrieve artifacts generated during pipeline execution.

Returns:

Artifacts like encoders and scalers

saved during execution.

Return type:

List[Artifact]

execute() → dict[str, Tensor][source]

Execute the pipeline.

Performs preprocessing, splitting, training, and evaluation.

Returns:

Dictionary with evaluation metrics

and model predictions.

Return type:

dict[str, Tensor]

property model: Model

Access the pipeline’s model.

Returns:

The model instance used in the pipeline.

Return type:

Model

to_artifact(name: str, version: str) → Artifact[source]

Serialize the pipeline instance into an artifact.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the pipeline.

  • version (str) – The version of the pipeline.

Returns:

Serialized pipeline artifact.

Return type:

Artifact

Module contents

ML package of the oop package. Includes modules artifact, dataset, feature, metric, pipeline, and subpackages.
